snippet: Mauricio Macri, the mayor of Buenos Aires, has driven a wedge into the dominating movement led by President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT

abstract: Argentine presidential candidates Mauricio Macri and Daniel Scioli rush to court new constituencies before runoff election in surprisingly tight campaign; experts are shocked by ascendance of patrician Macri, who despite his success as Buenos Aires' mayor, was not expected to threaten Scioli, candidate endorsed by Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner.
lead_paragraph: Mauricio Macri, the mayor of Buenos Aires, has driven a wedge into the dominating movement led by President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner.

headline.print_headline: Argentine Vote Shakes Assumptions on Departing President’s Clout
headline.main: Argentina Election Shakes Assumptions on Departing Leader’s Clout
